head.supplied: [26 July 1897] ¶ ¶ [re presidential address of Deane for Linn. Soc.] Regarding your reference to Baron Von Mueller I may inform you that he intended to bring out the Supplement to the Flora in accord...

div.p: MS 610/21/430, Deane family papers, National Library of Australia, Canberra.

[re presidential address of Deane for Linn. Soc.] Regarding your reference to Baron Von Mueller I may inform you that he intended to bring out the Supplement to the Flora in accordance with Bentham's arrangement and the M.S. as far as ready at the time of his death was sorted accordingly. It was however only a rough compilation only about half a dozen pages being revised by the Baron and the whole not even read over by me, after I had written it out — about 250 species. His Trustees, in whose hands the MS is, seem however determined to publish it just as it is, though the description of some new genera is not even written out.
